objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the organization that authored the threat report on Rhythmic Parry, was made aware of the malware in Autumn 2021, and created the associated YARA rules.

objects.name: Anti-emulation file check
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry checks for the existence of this file to ensure it is running in a full Windows environment and not an emulator.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry C2 Beacon (LocalData.dll)
objects.description: C2 beacon URL used by the LocalData.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry. Victim-specific UUID parameter has been removed.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry C2 Domain (LocalData.dll)
objects.description: C2 domain used by the LocalData.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry C2 Beacon (DiagView.dll)
objects.description: C2 beacon URL used by the DiagView.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry. Victim-specific UUID parameter has been removed.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry C2 Domain (DiagView.dll)
objects.description: C2 domain used by the DiagView.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry Mutex (LocalData.dll)
objects.description: Mutex created by the LocalData.dll variant to ensure only one instance is running on a system.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry Mutex (DiagView.dll)
objects.description: Mutex created by the DiagView.dll variant to ensure only one instance is running on a system.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry Log File (LocalData.dll)
objects.description: Log file created in the temporary directory by the LocalData.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry.

objects.name: Rhythmic Parry Log File (DiagView.dll)
objects.description: Log file created in the temporary directory by the DiagView.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry.

objects.name: Indicator for Rhythmic Parry Downloader (LocalData.dll) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Rhythmic Parry downloader variant LocalData.dll, which uses HTTP for C2 communications.

objects.name: Indicator for Rhythmic Parry Downloader (LocalData.dll) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Rhythmic Parry downloader variant LocalData.dll, which uses HTTP for C2 communications.

objects.name: Indicator for Rhythmic Parry Downloader (LocalData.dll) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Rhythmic Parry downloader variant LocalData.dll, which uses HTTP for C2 communications.

objects.name: Indicator for Rhythmic Parry Downloader (DiagView.dll) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Rhythmic Parry downloader variant DiagView.dll, which uses HTTPS for C2 communications.

objects.name: Indicator for Rhythmic Parry Downloader (DiagView.dll) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Rhythmic Parry downloader variant DiagView.dll, which uses HTTPS for C2 communications.

objects.name: Indicator for Rhythmic Parry Downloader (DiagView.dll) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Rhythmic Parry downloader variant DiagView.dll, which uses HTTPS for C2 communications.

objects.name: rhythmic parry
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry is a 64-bit Windows DLL downloader observed in two variants (LocalData.dll and DiagView.dll). It maintains persistence via scheduled tasks and utilizes anti-analysis techniques such as junk code and string obfuscation (Base64 and XOR). It communicates with a C2 server over HTTP or HTTPS to download, decrypt (AES-256-CBC), and execute a second-stage payload in memory.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry has been installed as a Scheduled Task to maintain persistence.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Binary Padding
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry contains junk code with a consistent pattern, including unused exports and indirect calls.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry hard-coded configuration strings are XOR-encoded with a 6-byte key, then Base64-encoded.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry uses HTTP or HTTPS to download a payload from a C2 server.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry downloads a second-stage payload which is encrypted using AES-256-CBC with an IV of zero.

objects.name: rp_config_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_config_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Base64 and XOR encoded strings which in plaintext
appear in both samples of Rhythmic Parry."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"
    strings:

$LD_UA = "OQALACoADAACAAMAEABbAFEAfgBVAE4ARwAmAB0ACgA0AAoAGQAcAFEAOgAwAHAAVABeAEEA
QQBPAEQABwAMAAAAWQBFAE8ARAAoAFMAWgBGAFEANQAUACAACQALADgAFAAWAC8AOQARAEEAW
zBCAEMASgBjAFMATgBHADoAPAAwAB0AKQBCAE8AHQAdAA8ANQBFACkACgASAB8ACwB5AEUALQ
AHAAMAGwAJADUASgBaAF0AXwBEAEoAYgBWAF8AXgBfAEUAVwBlAEUAPQAOABcAFQAWADkASgB
bAFwARgBaAFcAZgBFACsACwAWABEASwBhAFcAQABdAEUAQgA=" wide

$DV_UA = "GgA5ADAAPgAjAC0AMgB4AGMAZABnAG8AaQAEAD4AOAAuADgAOAAyAHMAGQACAGoAZgB/AG8A
YwBsAHYAHQA+ACEAdwBnAGwAdgAyAGEAewBoAHMAFgAmADoAOwAqABYANgA1AB0AIwAjAGAAd
ABgAGAAeAB5AGEAbwBpABgAHwACAAcAGwBjAGEAPwA+AD0ALwB3AAgAJAAwADwAOQBjAHcADA
ApACEAOAA7AC8AeAB7AHMAfQBnAHgAeABkAH4AcAB9AGYAZQB/AHcAHAAgADUANgAkACMAeAB
6AHIAZAB5AGUAfAB3AAoAJQA0ADIAeQB7AGUAYQBzAGcAYQA=" wide

$LD_EXP = "FwBeAAwAOQAZAAYAHwAQAAsAJwAWADIAMwAUAAwAFAA8AAoAHAAKAAMAWgABACgAAAA=" wide

$DV_EXP = "NABsABYACwA4ACgAPQAzADkAPQAkABMAHQA2AC8AJgAmADgAPQAkACEAeQAzADIAMgA=" wide

    condition:

        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and (2

of ($LD_*) or 2 of ($DV_*))
}

objects.name: rp_junk_code
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_junk_code {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Highlights common junk code sections identified in
both Rhythmic Parry samples."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"

    strings:

$post_writefile = {C7 84 24 ?? ?? 00 00 00 00 00 00 48 8B 84 24 ??

?? 00 00 48 89 8C 24 ?? ?? 00 00 48 89 C1 48 8D 05 ?? ?? ?? 00 89 94 24
?? ?? 00 00 48 89 C2 41 B8}

$temp_path_a = {41 B8 C8 00 00 00 89 8C 24 ?? ?? 00 00 44 89 C1}

    condition:

        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and

        filesize > 500KB and (#temp_path_a > 30) and (#post_writefile > 12)
}

objects.name: rp_import_obfuscation
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_import_obfuscation {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Import obfuscation is achieved by pushing
immediate character values onto the stack while applying single byte
global XOR to each, the global XOR is reinitiated each time it is
applied. This rule highlights the four-instruction sequence to achieve
this."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"

    strings:

$char_sequence_eax = {0F BE 05 [4] 83 F0 ?? 88 C1 88 8C 24 [4] 0F

BE 05}
    condition:

        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and

        #char_sequence_eax > 20
}

objects.name: rp_hash_payload
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_hash_payload {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Hash comparison routine used to check downloaded
payload in Rhythmic Parry samples."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"
    strings:

$hash_1 = {0F BE ?? ?? 48 8B 44 24 ?? ?? 63 ?? 24 ?? ?? 0F BE}

        $hash_2 = {0F 84 08 00 00 00 C7 44 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 E9 00 00 00
00 8B 44 24 ?? 83 C0 01 89 44 24 ?? E9 ?? ?? FF FF}

$hash_3 = {C7 44 24 ?? 01 00 00 00 48 8B ?? 24 [1-5] 48 89 44 24 ??

48 83 [3-6] 00 0F 85 0D 00 00 00 C7 44 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 E9}

    condition:

        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and

        all of them
}

objects.name: rp_xor_routine
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_xor_routine {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets the XOR routine used to decode
configuration strings in both observed Rhythmic Parry samples."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"
    strings:

$xor_1 = {48 8B ?? 24 ?? [0-3] 48 63 ?? 24 ?? [0-3] 0F B? 14 ?8 48

63 ?? 24}
        $xor_2 = {45 31 C0 89 54 24 ?? 44 89 C2 48 F7 ?? 24 ?? [0-3] 44
(0F BE 84 14|8A 8C)}
        $xor_3 = {00 00 66 45 89 C1 45 0F B7 C1 44 8B 54 24 ?? 45 31 C2
66 45 89 D1}
    condition:

        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and 2

of them
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Rhythmic Parry
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. rhythmic parry.
